20111GC-d-10-17-11-RPRC.Contributing Accident Cause: Highway user deliberately disregarded crossing warning devices
20111GC-d-10-17-11-RPRC.Narrative: ON 10/17/11, AT 09:05 HRS. RPRC'S SWITCH CREW WAS OPERATING LOCOMOTIVE GMTX 128, AND PULLING 24 CARSLOADED IRON ORE CARS FROM 23RD STREET YARD TO THE LEVIN RICHMOND TERMINAL CO (LRTC)  FACILITY IN RICHMOND, CA. THE TRAIN WAS OPERATING  WITH THE LOCOMOTIVE PULLING  THE 24 CARS GEOGRAPHICALLY NORTH THROUGH THE SOUTH END OF LRTC'S PARR YARD FACILITY (TRACK 122). AT THE GRADE CROSSING FOR LRTC FACILITY (DOT# 931046R), THE CREW OBSERVED A TRUCK CROSSING AHEAD OF THEM, AT WHICH TIME THEY SOUNDED THEHORN AND BELL. THE TRUCK CLEARED THE CROSSING AND THEN PROCEEDED TO MAKE A FAST U-TURN AND CAME BACKTOWARD THE CROSSING. THE CREW AGAIN SOUNDED THE HORN FREQUENTLY, BUT THE TRUCK CONTINUED ONTO THE CROSSING. THE ENGINEER PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY ( ALL CARS HAD THEIR BRAKES HOOKED UP AND OPERATING), BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE STRIKING THE TRUCK. THE TRUCK WAS STILL MOVING ACROSS  THE GRADE CROSSING AT TIME OF IMPACT. ACCORDING TO CREW STATEMENTS THE TRUCK DRIVER NEVER ACKNOWLEDGED THEHORN AND BELL SIGNALS  FROM THE TRAIN, OR THE PRESENCE OF THE TRAIN ITSELF AT ANY POINT. HE WAS ALSOOBSERVED TO BE WEARING A "BLUETOOTH" PHONE DEVICE IN HIS RIGHT EAR AT TIME OF IMPACT. THE TRAIN PUSHED THE TRACTOR APPROX. 35 FEET BEFORE STOPPING. TAKING INTO AN ACCOUNT THE TONNAGE OF THE TRAIN ( 2400 TONS+) AND THE RELATIVE SHORT DISTANCE TRAVELED AFTER IMPACT, THE TRAIN COULD NOT HAVE BEEN GOING OVER 5MPH, THEREFORE NOT IN EXCESS OF TIMETABLE ALLOWABLE SPEED. THE TRUCK DRIVER EXPLAINED CLAIME

M661811-d-10-10-11-ABS.Primary Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
M661811-d-10-10-11-ABS.Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
M661811-d-10-10-11-ABS.Narrative: ABSR 131 CREW GOT ON TRAIN FROM CSXT AT 14TH ST ON NS MAINLINE.  UPON DEPARTURE OF THE TRAIN THE CREW REPORTED THAT THE WAMX 4119 AND WAMX 4117 HAD FLAT SPOTS ON THE WHEELS.   THE TRAIN WAS BROUGHT TOTUSCALOOSA AND INSPECTED AND IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE WAMX 4117 #2 AXLE HAS A 1 1/2" FLAT SPOT AND THE WAMX 4119 #2 AND #3 AXLES HAVE 3" FLAT SPOTS.  IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THESE TWO LOCOMOTIVES WERE MOVED WITH THE HANDBRAKES STILL ON WHILE THEY WERE ON THE CSX PROPERTY.  THIS SET OF POWER WAS DELIVERED ON FRIDAY OCTOBER 7TH WITH NO ISSUES OR FLATS SPOTS.  ALSO THE LOCOMOTIVE INSPECTION REPORTSFROM THE 7TH DID NOT INDICATE ANY ISSUES WHEN WE DELIVERED THEM TO THE CSX.  DUE TO THE NS REROUTETRAIN THE POWER STAYED IN BIRMINGHAM UNTIL MONDAY OCTOBER 10TH WHEN THE TRAIN WAS BROUGHT TO US AT 14TH ST.  THIS IS WHEN THE FLAT SPOTS WERE REPORTED.  NOTE THAT ABS TEAM DOES NOT OPERATE ON CSX PROPERTY AND THE TRAIN WAS DELIVERED TO US ON NS PROPERTY.  WE WILL BE BILLING CSXT BACK FOR ALL COSTS.CSX WILL NOT BE FILING A FORM 6180.54 REPORT FOR THIS ACCIDENT.

TSE0001-d-10-31-11-TSE.Narrative: ON OCTOBER 3, 2011, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:30 AM, A TRANSFER TRAIN CONSISTING OF ONE LOCOMOTIVE AND FIVE CARS DERAILED. AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 3 MPH. THERE WERE NO INJURIES OR HAZARDOUS MATERIALS INVOLVED IN THE DERAILMENT. THE WEATHER WAS CLEAR AND TEMPERATURE WAS70 DEGREES F. THE ENGINEER REPORTED THAT SHORTLY AFTER CROSSING THE MLK STREET RAIL CROSSING AND TRAVELING NORTHWARD ON TRACK NUMBER THREE, HE FELT THE LOCOMOTIVE VIBRATE AND KNEW THAT SOMETHING WAS WRONG. THE ENGINEER STOPPED THE TRAIN AND ASKED HIS CONDUCTOR TO INSPECT THE TRAIN. THE CONDUCTOR WALKING SOUTHWARD DOWN THE TRAIN FOUND THE 3RD AND 4TH CARS DERAILED. THE INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO WIDE GAGE AND DEFECTIVE TIES. THERE WAS NO DRUG AND ALCOHOL TEST CONDUCTED.

000095421-d-10-08-11-CSX.Narrative: THE STANLEY YARDMASTER INSTRUCTED INBOUND TRAIN CREW OF Q50808 (CSXT ? 7873) TO ADD THEIR INBOUND TRAIN WITH 30 CARS TO SOUTH END OF RECEIVING TRACK R-08 WITH 52 CARS AND NO AIR AND SHOVE TRAIN INTO CLEAR. THE CREW OF THE Q50808 CALLED THE STANLEY YARDMASTER ON THE RADIO AND ASKED IF HE COULD SEE THE REAR END OF THEIR TRAIN IN THE CAMERA AND THEY ASKED IF THEY HAD ROOM TO SHOVE THE TRAIN IN QUIETLY. THE STANLEY YARDMASTER ADVISED THE CREW VIA THE RADIO THAT THE REAR END OF THEIR TRAIN WAS UNDERTHE 795 OVERPASS AND THAT THEY HAD 20 ? 25 CAR LENGTHS OF ROOM AND THAT IS WAS OK. THE YARDMASTER DID NOT CHECK HIS INVENTORY WHEN IN FACT TRACK R-08 HAD 103 CARS NOT 52 CARS AS HE ADVISED THE CREW OFQ50808. THE CREW OF Q50808 DID NOT PROTECT THEIR SHOVE MOVEMENT RESULTING IN  Q50808 SHOVEING OUT THE NORTH END OF TRACK R-08 INTO THE WEST SIDE OF Y19508 RCO HUMP JOB THAT WAS HUMPING OUT OF TRACK R-07. THE END RESULT WAS Q50808 DERAILED ONE CAR IN R-08 AND SIDE SWIPED FOUR CARS, TWO EACH IN R08 &R07.

NO CARS WERE DERAILED HOWEVER AMTRAK SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE4 REAR PASSENGER CARS AND THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGE TO CN 415323. INVESTIGATION INTO THE ACCIDENT FOUND THAT THE VHLC CONTROL POINT AT BRIDGEPORT IS EQUIPED WITH "SECTIONAL RELEASING" THIS IS ALLOWABLEIF THE TRACK CIRCUITS HAVE CLEARANCE OF A MINIMUM OF 13'6". TRACK 11 AND TRACK 13 DID NOT HAVE THE REQUIRED CLEARANCE. THE #3 CROSSOVER HAS BEEN REMOVED FROM SERVICE UNTIL NEW SOFTWARE IS WRITTEN ANDCUT OVER AGAIN.  AMTRAK REPORTED $227,190 IN EQUIPMENT DAMAGE.

31F101101-d-10-07-11-GRW.Primary Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
31F101101-d-10-07-11-GRW.Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
31F101101-d-10-07-11-GRW.Narrative:
AT 0127 HOURS THE 2400 CPOH YARD FOREMAN NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR THAT HE HAD SHOVED TWO EMPTY SLAB GONDOLAS OVER A CONCRETE BLOCK BUMPING POST AT THE END OF TRACK 113H. THE CREW WAS ASSIGNED TO ADD FIVE EMPTY SLAB GONDOLAS TO THE TRACK. THE YARD FOREMAN WAS CONTROLLING THE MOVE FROM THE HEAD END OFTHE FIVE CARS TO BE SET. THE FOREMAN MADE THE JOINT ON THE STANDING CARS ON 113H AND FROM HIS VANTAGE POINT THOUGHT THAT THERE WERE ABOUT 18 CARS ON THE TRACK. THE FOREMAN STATED THAT ALTHOUGH HE COULD NOT SEE THE END OF THE TRACK HE FELT HE HAD ROOM TO SHOVE IN THE FIVE ADDITIONAL CARS. HE THEN DIRECTED THE ENGINE TO SHOVE FIVE (5) CAR LENGTHS INTO THE TRACK. AFTER SPOTTING THE CARS AND CUTTING THE ENGINE OFF THE CREW WAS PULLING OUT OF THE TRACK AND THE FOREMAN STATED THAT HE THEN SAW THE TRACK FROM A DIFFERENT VANTAGE POINT. HE FELT THERE WERE MORE CARS ON THE TRACK THAN HE INITIALLY THOUGHT. HE THEN DIRECTED HIS CREW TO DELIVER ONE CAR THAT THEY HAD SET OUT FOR THE PLATE MILL WHILE HE WALKED TO THE END OF THE 113H TRACK. IT WAS THEN THAT HE FOUND HE HAD SHOVED OVER THE END OF THE TRACK. THE LEAD CAR GRW 87793 DERAILED ALL WHEELS WITH EAST END TRUCK OUT FROM UNDER THE CAR. THE SECONDCAR GRW 87526 DERAILED THE NUMBER ONE, EAST TRUCK, WITH MINIMAL DAMAGE.    

***INITIALLY COMPLETED FORM 97 ON 10/12/11 BECAUSE IT DID NOT MEET REPORTABLE CRITERIA, BUT FINAL DAMAGES COSTS HAVE NOWEXCEEDED THRESHOLD MAKING IT REPORTABLE.  A FORM 54 WILL BE COMPLETED***

1011PD008-d-10-14-11-UP.Narrative: THE YPD50R-14 WAS SHOVING EAST INTO TRACK 23 WHEN THE TRAIN CAME APART BETWEEN THE 54TH AND 55TH CAR.  CARS CONTINUED TO ROLL AND STRUCK THE MHKPD-14 THAT HAD PULLED INTO TRACK 24, WAITING TO PULL OUTON THE WEST END TO MAKE THE DOUBLE OVER.  THE REAR CAR IN TRACK 23 DERAILED WHILE NO CARS ON THE THE MHKPD-14 DERAILED.  AFTER REVIEWING DOWNLOAD NO EXCEPTIONS WERE TAKEN FOR TRAIN HANDLING AND NO DEFECTS WERE FOUND IN THE COUPLING MECHANISMS OF BOTH CARS THAT CAME APART.  PART OF THE CUT OF CARS RELEASED FROM CUT BEING SHOVED WERE PROTECTED BY CREW PER RULE 6.5.  COUPLING WAS MADE ONTO CARS RELEASED PER CONDITIONS ON RULE 74.1.  MECHANICAL DEPT COULD NOT IDENTIFY ANY MECHANICAL FAILURE EITHERBY INSPECTION OR REPLICATION OF EVENT.

1011RS003-d-10-05-11-UP.Narrative: MNPRVB-03, LEAD UNIT UP7631, WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON THE NO 1 MAIN TRACK.  THE TRAIN ROUNDED A CURVE AND SAW A 1978 TWO-TONED BLUE AND SILVER FORD F150 PICKUP TRUCK THAT WAS STUCK IN THE MUD, FOULING THE TRACKS.  TRAIN STRUCK THE VEHICLE, DISLODGING IT FROM THE MUD AT WHICH TIME THE TRUCK FLED THE SCENE.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES REPORTED.  THE NEAREST CROSSING IS APPROXIMATELY A HALF MILE FROM WHERE THE INCIDENT OCCURRED.

M502911-d-10-17-11-EIRR.Narrative:
CREW COMPLETED SHOVE IN YARD TRACK 139. CREW FAILED TO ASSURE CARS WERE SECURED PROPERLY AND CONTINUED TO MAKE THE NEXT MOVE FROM
TRACK 139 TO TRACK 140. CONDUCTOR BEGAN MAKING SHOVE YARD MAIN TO 140TRACK AND NOTICED CARS IN 139 ROLLING TOWARDS TRAIN HE WAS
SHOVING. CREW WAS UNABLE TO STOP MOVEMENT PRIOR TO CARS MAKING CONTACT AT THE YARD MAIN AND NEAR TRACK 139 WEST SWITCH DAMAGING TWO
RAIL CARS SEVERELY. NO CARS WERE DERAILED, NO TRACK DAMAGE
